intro: Clusia lutea, commonly known as the yellow glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are thick, waxy, and often have a yellowish or greenish hue, while its flowers are clustered in bright yellow cyathia. Clusia lutea is adapted to coastal and tropical environments, often thriving in sandy or limestone soils.
